dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, big news for Tesla, uh, the FBI is apparently looking into them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, big news for Tesla, uh, the F B I is apparently looking into them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Federal Bureau of Investigation is reviewing public statements by the Palo Alto, California-based company dating back to early 2017 to determine if it misled investors based on what it said regarding its ability to produce the Model 3, according to The Wall Street Journal, citing unnamed people familiar with the matter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty wild. They're reviewing public statements from like, early 2017, trying to figure out if Tesla misled investors about their Model 3 production numbers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's pretty wild. They're reviewing public statements from like, early twenty seventeen, trying to figure out if Tesla misled investors about their Model three production numbers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Federal Bureau of Investigation is reviewing public statements by the Palo Alto, California-based company dating back to early 2017 to determine if it misled investors based on what it said regarding its ability to produce the Model 3...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, because Musk was always hyping up those targets, wasn't he?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, because Musk was always hyping up those targets, wasn't he?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And The Wall Street Journal, citing unnamed sources, is saying this is a real thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And The Wall Street Journal, citing unnamed sources, is saying this is a real thing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...according to The Wall Street Journal, citing unnamed people familiar with the matter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Tesla, though, they're saying, "Hey, we cooperated with the DOJ on an earlier document request, but no subpoena, no big deal since then."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Tesla, though, they're saying, Hey, we cooperated with the D O J on an earlier document request, but no subpoena, no big deal since then.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla confirmed in an e-mailed statement that earlier this year it received a voluntary request for documents from the Department of Justice about its public guidance for the Model 3 ramp and we were cooperative in responding to it. We have not received a subpoena, a request for testimony, or any other formal process...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. They said they haven't had any new document requests in months, so it's kinda gone quiet on that front, at least from the Department of Justice.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. They said they haven't had any new document requests in months, so it's kinda gone quiet on that front, at least from the Department of Justice.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and there have been no additional document requests about this from the Department of Justice for months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But Elon *did* say, back in early 2017, that they'd hit 5,000 Model 3s a week by the fourth quarter of 2017.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Elon did say, back in early twenty seventeen, that they'd hit five thousand Model three seconds a week by the fourth quarter of twenty seventeen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Musk had said early last year that production of Model 3, currently priced from $46,000, would reach 5,000 units per week in 2017s fourth quarter...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and, um, they definitely didn't hit that. I mean, they only averaged about 4,300 units a week in the third quarter later on, even though they hit 5,000 intermittently much later.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and, um, they definitely didn't hit that. I mean, they only averaged about four thousand, three hundred units a week in the third quarter later on, even though they hit five thousand intermittently much later.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In fact, the company built only about 2,700 of the cars last year. Although it has reached the 5,000 a week rate intermittently since this years second half, Tesla said in its results letter to shareholders that production averaged 4,300 units a week in the third quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And the FBI investigation, uh, apparently it slowed down quite a bit after that whole SEC drama with Musk's "taking Tesla private" tweets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And the F B I investigation, uh, apparently it slowed down quite a bit after that whole S E C drama with Musk's taking Tesla private tweets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The pace of activity in the investigation, which is led by the U.S. attorneys office in San Francisco, intensified after Musk and Tesla settled a dispute with the Securities and Exchange Commission stemming from his tweets in August about taking Tesla private, the report said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, which led to that settlement where he had to step down as chairman â€“ a role he never even officially assumed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, which led to that settlement where he had to step down as chairman - a role he never even officially assumed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As part of a settlement concluded this month, Musk agreed to step down as Teslas chairman, a position he assumed long before becoming its CEO...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] And the $20 million fine! Plus Tesla paid another $20 million and had to add two independent directors. So, pretty significant consequences there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the twenty million dollar fine! Plus Tesla paid another twenty million dollars and had to add two independent directors. So, pretty significant consequences there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and pay a $20 million fine to settle the matter. Tesla also must pay a further $20 million and add two independent directors to its board.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: You'd think so. The stock actually dropped fifteen percent right after those quarterly results came out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You'd think so. The stock actually dropped fifteen percent right after those quarterly results came out.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla shares surged 15%, or by $42.40, to $330.90 in the days following its surprise quarterly results.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But then Tesla's defense, man, it's classic. They said their philosophy is to set "sandbagged targets," not "truthful" ones that they'd definitely exceed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then Tesla's defense, man, it's classic. They said their philosophy is to set sandbagged targets, not truthful ones that they'd definitely exceed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla defended its past statements, and that its philosophy has always been to set truthful targets not sandbagged targets that we would definitely exceed and not unrealistic targets that we could never meet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they even said they were transparent about how easy the Model 3 ramp would be, calling it "production paradise."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they even said they were transparent about how easy the Model three ramp would be, calling it production paradise.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When we started the Model 3 production ramp, we were transparent about how difficult it would be, openly explaining that we would only be able to go as fast as our least lucky or least successful supplier and that we were entering production hell, the company said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which, um, clearly it wasn't. But then they also claim it took them six months *less* than they *expected* to hit that 5,000 unit per week guidance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, um, clearly it wasn't. But then they also claim it took them six months less than they expected to hit that five thousand unit per week guidance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ultimately, given difficulties that we did not foresee in this first-of-its-kind production ramp, it took us six months longer than we expected to meet our 5,000 unit per week guidance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, they *expected* it to take even longer than it did internally, despite what Musk said publicly? It's always a bit of a, uh, twisting narrative with Tesla, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, they expected it to take even longer than it did internally, despite what Musk said publicly? It's always a bit of a, uh, twisting narrative with Tesla, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Absolutely. Never a dull moment with their pronouncements, that's for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Never a dull moment with their pronouncements, that's for sure.
